title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Augusta Jordan to O. O. Howard, April 14, 1866
summary: Augusta Jordan asks for aid on behalf of Eveline Stuart, an African-American woman living in Staunton. Her husband James, living in Ohio, is afraid to return to Staunton because he served as a Union guide during the war, and wishes to bring Eveline to Ohio.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Women, Family, Military Authority, Patriotism, American Civil War
